title: Numericals with Varying Baselines
content: Hey guys! I'm currently working on some collateral material for a brand I've created. I'm looking for a serif style font that has variations in their baselines for its numericals. Fonts in the vein of [Poster Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419204606/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/poster-bodoni) or [Encorpada Classic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419204606/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dootype/encorpada-classic) are what I've been playing with. Thanks for any suggestions!
author: luccio

comments.content:
The type of numerals you're after are called "old style figures" or "ranging figures" or (more rarely, but quite suitably) "text figures". They were unpopular for about a century (after being the standard style for text cuts of typefaces for the previous four centuries or so), but have recently had a significant resurgence – just about any professional serif face designed in the past decade (and quite a few in the preceding ones) will have them somewhere, and quite a few will have them as standard.

That said, the high-contrast style you've been looking at (the "didones" or "moderns" originally appearing in the nineteenth century) feature old style numerals more rarely than most – mainly because that's precisely when they went out of fashion, so the original fonts now revived often didn't have them. Here's some that MyFonts throws up for a search for didone+old-style numerals:

[http://www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Adidone+tag%3A%22old-style+numerals%2...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419204606/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Adidone+tag%3A%22old-style+numerals%22/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Adidone+tag%3A%22old-style+numerals%22/fonts/")

(PS. Encorpada's "Pro" version has old style numerals: [http://myfonts.us/td-XACOSE](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419204606/http:/myfonts.us/td-XACOSE "http://myfonts.us/td-XACOSE") ... Also, [Velino Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419204606/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/velino-display/) and [Battista](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419204606/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/preusstype/battista/).)

[Scotch Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419204606/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/scotch-modern/) has old style ﬁgures as alternates, in the OpenType menu.  
(I put both lining and OSF ﬁgures in most of my typefaces, so don’t tag it with a keyword, which is why it didn’t show up in the MyFonts search.)
